monogr.title: Pharmaco-pinax, or A table and taxe of the pryces of all vsuall medicaments, simple and composed, contayned in D. Gordon's apothecarie and chymicall shop : within Mr Robert Farquhar's high lodging, in New Aberdene. Together with certayne approved remedies against diseases, which now most reigne amongst the commons. All for the vse of the people; proportionate both to rich and poore, learned and unlearned; and profitable to all
monogr.author: Gordon, D., apothecary

div.head: Advertisement for the following Drogs.
div.p: SEeing this Arte hath ever hither-to vnder-lyen the slander, That poore Folkes cannot bee benefited by it; wee haue for their Solagement prepared some cheape Medicaments, which indeede worketh the same effect as those of the Rich: but the Ingredients are not so exactlie refined, nor the Compositions so delicate in taking, or pleasant in working, Tales habent labra lactucas. Wee haue lyke-wyse framed some approved Remeadies, to the most frequent Diseases of the People: who if they cannot endure a methodicall eradicating cure, at least, they shall receiue an Empericall Remead, quasi vnum pro omnibus, which wee hope shall doe their turne in a good measure, as they will record that pleases to essay them.

Also, wee haue provided, good store of Cordiall Waters, and Antidotes for the Pest, which now ravaging our Neighbour Kingdomes, may invade vs next: considering the maligne influence, the vnconstancie and vnkindlinesse of the Aire, sudden death, and vnacustomed symptomes of Sowning, that followeth Diseases this yeare: but aboue all, our lewd lyues; if fervent Repentance, and frostie Winter, interveining, prev • ane not. GOD of His Mercie maintaine vs this Peace and Plentie, that wee may safely throng into the House of GOD, and breathe in others Faces, with-out danger.
